column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Text=( ( WS ) ) According to the New York Times , you were heavily involved in the 2004 split of the party that centered around five-time presidential nominee Earl Dodge . What exactly caused the split , and has the party since healed ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) To answer the last part first :
#Text=It has largely healed .
#Text=A few months after Dodge died , his hand-picked vice-chairman also died .
#Text=The man who was third in line refused to carry on .
#Text=That man , and the Dodge relatives , then dropped out completely ; the other folks mostly are now working with the regular organization .
#Text=The split was caused by dissatisfaction with Dodge ’s management .
#Text=Dodge was a somewhat paranoid person who trusted no one to help him .
#Text=For example , he made one of his daughters " treasurer " of the Prohibition National Committee , but he did not allow her access to the bank account .
#Text=He was the only " signer " listed on the check card .
#Text=Another example :

#Text=He used money from a bequest to purchase a small office condominium , then without telling even his vice-chairman , he mortgaged the condo , cashed it out , and after a time lost it ( because the mortgage was not being paid ) ; the vice-chairman discovered all this only after Dodge died .
#Text=Dodge could sell the office condo undetected , because he held it in the name of a shell corporation controlled by himself and the said daughter .

#Text=( ( WS ) ) The late Gene Amondson , the 2004 & 2008 presidential nominee of the Prohibition Party was the national face of the party for a number of years . How well did you know Mr. Amondson , and what is the current state of the party with his absence ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) I met Amondson at a couple of conventions ; otherwise , I knew him only from correspondence and from telephone calls .
#Text=Amondson was a congenial person , warm and approachable .
#Text=He was recommended to us by one of our supporters .
#Text=He had an act , a re-creation of Rev. Billy Sunday ’ s sermon on booze , which he performed at conservative churches and other sympathetic venues .
#Text=We hoped that his name recognition and the audience appeal of his act would enhance the Party ’s appeal .
#Text=As it turned out , he had a handicap , analogous to dyslexia , which prevented him from stringing words together into fluent sentences .
#Text=His act was great .
#Text=His public speaking and his writing were , um , unremarkable .
#Text=We miss his ability to attract attention to us .

#Text=( ( WS ) ) Mr. Amondson stated that " Prohibition was America 's greatest 13 years " and that he would " rather have 100 Al Capones in every city than alcohol sold in every grocery store " . Do you agree with these comments , and additionally , do you second his projection that " Prohibition will come again for the fourth time " ?

#Text=( ( JH ) ) I expect that national prohibition will come again " someday , " because nothing we 've tried since then has worked as well in reducing per-capita consumption of alcoholic beverages and the related social problems .
